channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024060165
item.description:
Report E-2024060165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: EAST SAINT LOUIS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 6, 2024, seven (7) boxes of UN3149 were crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. EW personnel collected two (2) damaged 1-gallon containers of UN3149 and seven (7) damaged boxes of UN3149 (four 1-gallon containers in one box) and containerized them into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum as hazardous waste. EW personnel deployed vermiculite to the impacted surfaces of the trailer and worked them in with hand tools. EW personnel then utilized absorbent wipes to remove any residual amount of UN3149 from the impacted surfaces. All UN3149 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum

item.title: Report X-2024060318
item.description:
Report X-2024060318

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE FOUND WET AND TORN IN LOAD TRAILER 418. ONE PACKAGE HANDLER (6105796) HAD GOTTEN LIQUID ON SKIN AND CLOTHING; THEY FLUSHED WITH WATER. UPON INSPECTION, ONE CAN (OF SIX) HAD BEEN SEVERELY DENTED AND HAD LEAKED FROM PUNCTURE ON SIDE NEAR TOP. ALL CANS HAD BEEN DENTED AND SOILED. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

item.title: Report I-2024050052
item.description:
Report I-2024050052

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-21
  • City: GALT
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WAYNE TRANSPORTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Unit 1 was traveling West on 1-88 at approximately milepost 27. Unit 1 departed the roadway to the right and entered a grass ditch/ embankment. Unit 1 overturned. Unit 1 product was released from top port. Erie/ Rock Falls Fire responded. IL Dept of Conservation notified to examine any waterway contamination. Illinois Emergency Management Agency notified. Product Isolated/ contatned by sand delivered by Illinois Dept. of Transportation. Company arranged for Hazardous Material response and removal by HMR (HazMat Response) from Des Moines, IA (DOT 555940).

item.title: Report E-2024060075
item.description:
Report E-2024060075

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 6, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of hydrogen peroxide was punctured by a forklift and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew transferred the contents into one (1) new drum. EWI personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060064
item.description:
Report E-2024060064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: EAST MOLINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Response Management Services LLC was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-30ft area of the trailer floor and concrete lot and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to falling freight that crushed one (1) 15-gallon poly drum due to a load shift. Response Management Services personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizer to the impacted areas and gathered the spent absorbents. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The recovered absorbents were containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal

item.title: Report E-2024060118
item.description:
Report E-2024060118

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 4, 2024, one (1) 340-gallon tote of NA1993 was damaged due to faulty packaging and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged tote was diapered with plastic wrap to be sent with the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024060137
item.description:
Report E-2024060137

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 4, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the UN2922-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pail and debris were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.description:
Report X-2024060745

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO THE EAST PRIMARY FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO OCNTAINERIZE THE LEAKING CONTAINER AND CLEAN UP THE SPILLED MATERIAL. CONTAINER AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON THE CONTAINER, MATERIAL WAS NEUTRALIZED AND SOLIDIFIED, INFORMATION WAS ENTERED INTO ETT AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. THE PROCESSED MATERIAL WAS THEN PLACED IN THE UNCONFIRMED DMP STORAGE AREA, UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

item.title: Report E-2024060050
item.description:
Report E-2024060050

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN2922 Trumpet EC release from a 30-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and a 2’ x 20’ area of the concrete dock due to a fork puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected and containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024060429
item.description:
Report X-2024060429

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-12T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AIR PACKAGE TO PUERTO RICO HAD BROWN PAPER COVERING THE ENTIRE BOX. DURING PACKAGE HANDLING SOME OF THE PAPER WAS TORN EXPOSING A CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY DIAMOND LABEL. FURTHER REMOVAL OF THE PAPER REVEALED DANGEROUS GOODS MARKING OF UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PI 965 IA AND NET WEIGHT 21.03KG. THE BOX IS ALSO UN SPECIFICATION. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER BOX CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE ECOFLOW DELTA MAX (2000) PORTABLE POWER STATION. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER RY6239, GATORADE SPORTS, 404 W HARRISON, CHICAGO IL 60607.
